ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: a. Change in systolic blood pressure (SBP) during recovery from phase 3 nadir
b. Time over which this change occurs
Baroreflex sensitivity-adrenergic (BRS-A) is the rate (i.e. slope in mmHg/s) at which BP recovers from its nadir following release of the Valsalva maneuver
c. RR interval decrease
d. Corresponding systolic blood pressure (SBP) decrease
Baroreflex sensitivity-vagal (BRS-V) reflects how much the HR increases (or RR interval decreases) to compensate for decrease in BP in phase 2E of the Valsalva maneuver.
A1: Mean arterial pressure (MAP) drop in phase 2E
Notes: 0= Less than or equal to 20 mmHg; 1= 20-40 mmHg; 2= Greater than 40 mmHg

ElementDescription: A2: Phase 2E pulse pressure (PP) ratio
A3: Blood Pressure decrement on tilt table
Notes: 0= Change in SBP < 20 or change in MAP less than 10; 1= Change in SBP greater than or equal to 20 or change in MAP greater than or equal to 10; 2= Change in SBP greater than or equal to 25 or change in MAP greater than or equal to 15; 3= Change in SBP greater than or qequal to 30 or change in MAP greater than or equal to 20

ElementDescription: A4: Phase 2L
Notes: 0= Present; 1= Present but BP does not return to baseline; 2= Absent

ElementDescription: A5: Phase IV
A6: Baroreflex sensitivity atrial (BRS-A)
Adrenergic Index (0-14)
S1: Forearm
S2: Proximal leg
S3: Distal leg
S4: Foot
Sudomotor index score (0-16)
V1: heart rate response to deep breathing (HRDB)
Notes: 0= Normal; 1= 75-99% LLN; 2= 50-74% LLN; 3= 25-49% LLN; 4= < 24% LLN= but some variability; 5= No variability appreciated

ElementDescription: V2: VR (because this is a ratio, these percentages refer to the percentage of the difference from 1)
Notes: 0= Normal; 1= 75-99% LLN; 2= 50-74% LLN; 3= 25-49% LLN; 4= < 24% LLN= but some change; 5= No change appreciated

ElementDescription: V3: Baroreflex sensitivity ventricle BRS-V
Cardiovagal index score (0-15)
Modified Composite Autonomic Scoring Scale (m-CASS) Total
